issue.title: build(deps): bump less from 3.9.0 to 3.10.2

labels.name: type/dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

repository.name: Fomantic-UI
repository.description: Fomantic-UI is the official community fork of Semantic-UI

issue.body:
Bumps [less](https://github.com/less/less.js) from 3.9.0 to 3.10.2.
Changelog *Sourced from [less's changelog](https://github.com/less/less.js/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > ## 3.10.0-beta > > 2019-08-03 > - Switched codebase to ES2015 w/ Rollup/Babel compilation > - Added TS linter to ESLint (types yet to be added to functions / vars) > - Ignore undefined content in generating source maps ([#3360](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/less/less.js/issues/3360))
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/less/less.js/commits)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=less&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=3.9.0&new-version=3.10.2)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=less&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=3.9.0&new-version=3.10.2) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a "Dependabot enabled" badge to your readme Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com): - Update frequency (including time of day and day of week) - Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time) - Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates, if desired) - Security updates (receive only security updates, if desired) Finally, you can contact us by mentioning @dependabot.

issue.title: [Table] Unable to build table in the latest versions

labels.name: type/bug
labels.description: Any issue which is a bug or PR which fixes a bug

repository.name: Fomantic-UI
repository.description: Fomantic-UI is the official community fork of Semantic-UI

issue.body:
# Bug Report

Fomantic ui is unable to build from a fresh npm install

## Steps to reproduce
1. `npm init` a new directory
2. `npm i -D gulp fomantic-ui`
3. Follow all of the installation defaults
4. `npx gulp build --gulpfile semantic/gulpfile.js --cwd semantic/`

## Expected result

Successful build

## Actual result

A build that succeeds until it tries to build the table css:

```
[PluginError: Cannot create property '_index' on string '!important' in file /home/david/src/test/semantic/src/themes/default/collections/table.variables line no. 1] {
  message: "Cannot create property '_index' on string '!important' in file /home/david/src/test/semantic/src/themes/default/collections/table.variables line no. 1",
  stack: undefined,
  type: 'Syntax',
  filename: '/home/david/src/test/semantic/src/themes/default/collections/table.variables',
  index: NaN,
  line: 1,
  column: -1,
  callLine: NaN,
  callExtract: undefined,
  extract: [
    undefined,
    '/*******************************',
    '             Table'
  ],
  lineNumber: 1,
  fileName: '/home/david/src/test/semantic/src/themes/default/collections/table.variables',
  name: 'Error',
  plugin: 'gulp-less',
  showProperties: true,
  showStack: false,
  __safety: { toString: [Function: bound ] }
}
```

## Version
node `12.8.0` (also tested 10.16.2; same error)
npm `6.10.2`
fomantic-ui `2.7.7`
gulp `4.0.2`

---
EDIT: looks like someone else is encountering a similar error, it may be because the table.variables is the only file with `!important` https://stackoverflow.com/questions/57568988/gulp-less-fails-when-using-important

body: FWIW I had to revert down to 3.9.x in a project due to what _seems to be_ this same issue, but wasn't able to make a reduced test case at the time. The compiler (using webpack-contrib/less-loader in my case) failed on an `!important` used on a variable, and after removing the `!important`, the error moved on to the next `!important`.

issue.title: [gulp build] command results missing CSS files in output components directory

repository.name: Semantic-UI
repository.description: Semantic is a UI component framework based around useful principles from natural language.

issue.body:
### Steps
1. create an empty project, init `package.json`
1. `npm install semantic-ui`
1. in the Set-up Semantic UI screen:
   - Automatic -> Yes -> [ENTER] (default to semantic/) -> [ENTER] to install
1. `npx gulp --gulpfile semantic/gulpfile.js build`

### Expected Result
generate JS and CSS files for components in `semantic/dist/components`

### Actual Result
components missing `.css` and `.min.css`:
accordion, ad, card, checkbox, comment, dimmer, dropdown, embed, feed, item, modal, nag placeholder, popup, progress, rating, search, shape, sidebar, statistic, sticky, tab, table, transition, video


### Version
Semantic-UI: 2.4.2
Node: 10.16.1
NPM: 6.11.1

issue.title: An in-range update of less is breaking the build ðŸš¨
issue.body:
## The dependency [less](https://github.com/less/less.js) was updated from `3.9.0` to `3.10.0`. ðŸš¨ [View failing branch](https://github.com/kvadevack/site/compare/master...kvadevack:greenkeeper%2Fless-3.10.0). This version is **covered** by your **current version range** and after updating it in your project **the build failed**. less is a direct dependency of this project, and **it is very likely causing it to break**. If other packages depend on yours, this update is probably also breaking those in turn.
Status Details - âŒ **continuous-integration/travis-ci/push:** The Travis CI build failed ([Details](https://travis-ci.org/kvadevack/site/builds/573016335?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification)).
---
Commits

The new version differs by 11 commits.

  • 7e51ba1 Release v3.10.0 (#3413)
  • c0f5e97 v3.10.0-beta.2 -- Cleanup NPM and git included files (#3412)
  • bd76d65 Update CHANGELOG.md
  • f077e21 Release v3.10.0-beta
  • cae5021 Conversion of Less to ES6 w/ TypeScript type linting support (#3411)
  • 88e126b Fixes #3346 #3338 #3345 (#3363)
  • 162327a Operation.prototype.accept Issues#3327 (#3364)
  • 5cc99b5 Ignore undefined content in generating source maps (#3360)
  • 6155c4d Avoid Buffer constructor on newer Node.js (#3305) (#3307)
  • b50515c Do not pollute window object in less-browser bootstrap (#3352)
  • 764e883 Use the correct mime type when loading a plugin (#3337)

See the full diff
